title: Optimizing Model Selection for Compound AI Systems
author: Lingjiao Chen (Microsoft Research), Jared Quincy Davis (Stanford University), Boris Hanin (Princeton University), Peter Bailis (University of California, Berkeley), Matei Zaharia (University of California, Berkeley), James Zou (Stanford University), Ion Stoica (University of California, Berkeley), ...
relevance_why: The model selection framework proposed could enhance various audio processing tasks by allowing for the allocation of the most suitable models for different audio-related modules or tasks, leading to better performance in audio generation and enhancement.
background: The paper addresses the optimization of Compound Artificial Intelligence systems that utilize multiple large language models for distinct modules to boost task performance.
contribution: This paper introduces LLMSelector to solve the model selection problem in compound AI systems, achieving a performance improvement of 5%-70% compared to using a single model across all modules.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often deployed the same model for all modules in a compound AI system, which limited their performance by not leveraging the strengths of individual models.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by providing a systematic framework that iteratively selects optimal models for each module based on their estimated performance.

key_innovation: Employs a novel LLM diagnoser to estimate module-wise performance, allowing for efficient and informed model selection.
real_world_impact: By enabling better model selection in compound systems, the framework has significant potential to enhance various applications in AI, improving accuracy and efficiency. No immediate real-world impact.
limitations: The assumptions regarding monotonicity of performance may not hold in all scenarios, potentially limiting applicability.

new_terms.model selection problem: **Model selection problem** refers to the challenge of determining the best model from a set of candidates for specific tasks or modules in a system, particularly relevant in complex AI systems.
new_terms.LLM diagnoser: **LLM diagnoser** is a mechanism that estimates the performance of individual modules based on their outputs to guide model selection effectively.

open_sourcing: We release our code and data, including compound systems' intermediate outputs generated by commercial LLM APIs.
